did.unittitle: Pratt Faculty Union, UFCT Local 1460 Archived Websites
did.abstract: Pratt Faculty Union, UFCT Local 1460 Archived Websites (WAG 379) contains the websites for the Pratt Faculty Union, with captures beginning in September 2025. Local 1460 represents full-time and part-time faculty members at the Pratt Institute. The union signed their first collective bargaining agreement in 1973, after years of organizing at the Pratt Institute in the 1960s. The archived websites include the official website for the union, a Linktree, and their Instagram feed.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: New site crawls are accrued semiannually. During periods of bargaining, websites are captured more often.

appraisal.head: Take Down Policy
appraisal.p: Archived websites are made accessible for purposes of education and research. NYU Libraries have given attribution to rights holders when possible; however, due to the nature of archival collections, we are not always able to identify this information.
If you hold the rights to materials in our archived websites that are unattributed, please let us know so that we may maintain accurate information about these materials.

If you are a rights holder and are concerned that you have found material on this website for which you have not granted permission (or is not covered by a copyright exception under US copyright laws), you may request the removal of the material from our site by submitting a notice, with the elements described below, to the special.collections@nyu.edu.

Please include the following in your notice: Identification of the material that you believe to be infringing and information sufficient to permit us to locate the material; your contact information, such as an address, telephone number, and email address; a statement that you are the owner, or authorized to act on behalf of the owner, of an exclusive right that is allegedly infringed and that you have a good-faith belief that use of the material in the manner complained of is not authorized by the copyright owner, its agent, or the law; a statement that the information in the notification is accurate and made under penalty of perjury; and your physical or electronic signature. Upon receiving a notice that includes the details listed above, we will remove the allegedly infringing material from public view while we assess the issues identified in your notice.

appraisal.head: Appraisal
appraisal.p: Robots.txt was ignored. Websites were rescoped to include Google documents.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Websites are arranged alphabetically by title.

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
phystech.p: Due to technical or privacy issues, archived websites may not be exact copies of the original website at the time of the web crawl. Certain file types will not be captured dependent on how they are embedded in the site. Other parts of websites that the crawler has difficulty capturing includes Javascript, streaming content, database-driven content, and highly interactive content. Full-Text searches of archived websites are available at https://archive-it.org/organizations/567.
Crawling of the Instagram feed was performed in WebRecorder and Archive-It.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: In September 2025, https://www.instagram.com/ufct1460/, https://linktr.ee/ufct1460/, and https://www.pratt-union.org/ were selected by Shannon O'Neill and captured through the use of Archive-It. Archive-It uses web crawling technology to capture websites at a scheduled time and displays only an archived copy, from the resulting WARC file, of the website. The accession number associated with these websites is 2025.085.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Pratt Faculty Union, UFCT Local 1460 Archived Websites (WAG 379) contains the websites for the Pratt Faculty Union, with captures beginning in September 2025. The websites include the official website for the union, a Linktree, and their Instagram feed. The website contains copies of their contract (2022-2027); policies; constitutions and bylaws; and links to previous contracts. The website also describes the structure of the union's leadership and names its current officers; lists union delegates by department; provides an overarching history of the union; and maintains listings of events and news from the union. The Linktree page contains links to campaigns related to cross-shop solidarity; statements released by union leadership; guides to academic freedom; and open letters to the Pratt Institute. The Instagram feed includes posts on calls for actions to protect academic freedom on university campuses; posts on addresses specific workers/labor issues on Pratt's campus such as cuts in wages and changes to benefits; announcements for meetings and delegate elections; and events held or supported by the union.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: The Pratt Faculty Union, UFCT Local 1460, represents full-time and part-time faculty members at the Pratt Institute. The union signed their first collective bargaining agreement in 1973, after years of organizing at the Pratt Institute in the 1960s. The first president of the union was Estelle Horowitz. In 2007, Pratt and the union agreed on an "agency fee," giving faculty members either the choice to join the union or pay a fee to the union for services rendered by the Local 1460 on behalf of faculty at Pratt.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: The collection was maintained by Nicole Greenhouse. Maintenance of the collection consisted of rescoping due to missing captured content, redirects and content drift, missing embedded materials (such as videos or attached Google documents and pdfs), and other materials created by selected entities. The materials were arranged and described in November 2025 according to professional and local standards.
